name: CalendarDayGridBody
description:
Groups all parts of the calendar's day grid.
Renders a `<tbody>` element.

fixedWeekNumber.description:
Will render the requested amount of weeks by adding weeks of the next month if needed.
Put it to 6 to create a Gregorian calendar where all months have the same amount of weeks displayed.

offset.description:
The offset to apply to the rendered month compared to the current month.
This is mostly useful when displaying multiple day grids.

children.type: ReactNode | ((week: Date | DateTime, index: number, weeks: (Date | DateTime)[]) => ReactNode)
children.description:
The children of the component.
If a function is provided, it will be called for each week to render as its parameter.
children.detailedType:
| React.ReactNode
| ((
    week: Date | DateTime,
    index: number,
    weeks: (Date | DateTime)[],
  ) => ReactNode)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: Calendar.DayGridBody.State,
  ) => ReactElement)
